I have no personal experience, but i can suggest the following tips that may help a rugby player improve their tackling technique without risking injury:

1. focus on proper body positioning: a player should always maintain a low and balanced body position and keep their head up and eyes on the ball carrier. this helps create a stable base and allows the player to generate more power in their tackle.

2. use proper tackling technique: a player can reduce their risk of injuries by using proper tackling technique, such as using their shoulder to make contact with the ball carrier's midsection and wrapping their arms around the opponent's midsection and legs.

3. start slowly: it's important to start slowly and gradually build up tackling speed and intensity to avoid injuries.

4. use tackling bags or pads: tackling bags or pads simulate the same resistance and force as an opposing player, allowing players to practice their technique without putting themselves at risk of injury.

5. work on strengthening exercises: strengthening exercises for the leg, hip, and core muscles can help improve tackling technique and reduce the risk of injury.

6. receive proper coaching: lastly and most important, rugby players should receive proper coaching and feedback from experienced coaches who can identify and correct any flaws in their tackling technique before they become problematic.
